content.description: Chip Shot is the arete right of Blue Balls.  Start on the right side of the arete, above the sun shelter for picnic area #2.
content.protection: Use the same bolts as for Blue Balls.  Best to rig a directional for less swing time.

content.description:
This route climbs the brown, huecoless, face behind picnic shelter #2, left of the graffiti "Adolpho y Ernestina".   

  Sharp holds, but still worthy if you've got some spare tip tissue.
The route begins behind the sun shelter for picnic area #2. Start right of the graffiti "Adolpho y Ernestina".  Connect the irresistible line of huecos using small, sharp, iron-rock edges.
content.protection:
There are two bolts for the anchor, not too crazy to reach from the top.  Being ready to clip in and lower off will save time, since the approach is a bit circuitous. 

  These bolts can be backed up with finger sized cams in a crack reached by stepping across a crevasse about thirty feet back.

content.description: This is the shady wall above picnic site #2, visible from the ranger station.  The distinctive routes are top ropes on the front and the Choss Wall boulder problems on the backside.
